Comments_List: Screenwriting. The format and the rules.

This was my first foray into screenwriting and I learned so much about the proper format of screenplays and about telling stories in general. Workshopping with classmates was so rewarding and intensely fun. I learned to look at stories from a new perspective, where the building blocks of plot and dialogue are fluid, can be moved around and chopped up in different ways to craft an engaging narrative.
I learned about script formatting convention. I can now write a clean-looking script that would be acceptable by industry standards.

Weakness: only one script is written by the students. I feel like we can hand in more after having had some experience.
Strengths: very interesting and inspiring.

This course is good, but I think the reading requirement could be a bit larger, especially if we spend reading scripts as a class. I would have preferred a bit more direction in terms of the midterm packet requirements, but Lapadula turned out to be a relatively easy grader and the assignments were pretty straight forward.  A canvas site would be nice.
I dont know how to answer this question without implicating the instructor, which I dont intend to do until asked about him.
Yes. This course is very interesting and inspiring. The professor is enthusiastic.
Yes, I would definitely take this class if you can get in. It's super interesting, challenging and not that much work. Take this class.
Yes! Lapadula is the best! You also learn a lot about life in general --- not just screenwriting.
If they could take it with a different professor, probably. If Marc Lapadula was teaching it, almost certainly not.
